results.title: Progressive development of melanoma-induced cachexia differentially impacts organ systems in mice
results.text_hl: @GENE_ACE @GENE_1636 @@@ACE@@@ inhibition with the drug @<m>CHEMICAL_Lisinopril</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D017706 @@@lisinopril@@@ improves muscle force and partially impedes @<m>DISEASE_Cachexia</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D002100 @@@cachexia@@@-induced transcriptional changes, although @DISEASE_Wasting_Syndrome @DISEASE_MESH:D019282 @@@wasting@@@ is not prevented, suggesting that @DISEASE_Neoplasms @DISEASE_MESH:D009369 @@@cancer@@@-induced host-secreted factors can regulate tissue function during @<m>DISEASE_Cachexia</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D002100 @@@cachexia@@@.

citations.NLM: Graca FA, Stephan A, Wang YD, Shirinifard A, Jiao J, Vogel P, Labelle M, Demontis F. Progressive development of melanoma-induced cachexia differentially impacts organ systems in mice Cell Rep. 2023 Jan 31;42(1):111934. PMID: 36640353
